figureCitation.captionText: Figure 9. Macrocharacter of Cordyceps militaris a-e stromata and host of Cordyceps militaris (a collected from Daxing'an Mountains, Heilongjiang Province b collected from Ji'an County, Tonghua City, Jilin Province c, e collected from Changchun City, Jilin Province d collected from Qujin City, Huize County, Yunnan Province). Scale bars: 1 cm (a-e).

subSubSection.paragraph:
China . Yunnan Province : Qujin City , Huize County , 26.24°N , 103.25°E , 30 July 2019 , Jia-Jun Hu , Bo Zhang & Di-Zhe Guo (HMJAU 48256, GenBank Acc. nos.: ITS = MW888227 , LSU = MW893279 )
;
Jilin Province : Changchun City , Jingyuetan National Forest Park, 43.80°N , 125.50°E , 25 August 2018 , Jia-Jun Hu & Yong-Lan Tuo (HMJAU 48257)
;
Changchun City , Jingyuetan National Forest Park, 43.80°N , 125.50°E , 25 August 2018 , Jia-Jun Hu , Bo Zhang & Gui-Ping Zhao (HMJAU 48258)
;
Tonghua City ,
Ji'an County
, Wunvfeng National Forest Park, 41.28°N , 126.14°E , 25 August 2019 , Yong-Lan Tuo (HMJAU 48262)
;
Heilongjiang Province :
Daxing'an Mountains
, Shuanghe National Nature Reserve , 52.44°N , 125.40°E , 23 June 2019 , Di-Zhe Guo (HMJAU 48263)
.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 9. Macrocharacter of
Cordyceps militaris
a-e stromata and host of
Cordyceps militaris
( a collected from Daxing'an Mountains, Heilongjiang Province b collected from Ji'an County, Tonghua City, Jilin Province c, e collected from Changchun City, Jilin Province d collected from Qujin City, Huize County, Yunnan Province ). Scale bars: 1 cm ( a-e ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
C. militaris
is a widely distributed species and also a well-known medicinal fungus in China. At this time, we collected samples from many different places. The morphological evidence shows no apparent differences between each other. However, the habitat is markedly different.

caption.paragraph:
Table 2. Morphological comparisons of sexual states of
Cordyceps changchunensis
,
Cordyceps changbaiensis
and
Cordyceps jingyuetanensis
.

tr.td: Single or several, unbranched, slender and cylindrical, brownish- yellow to yellowish
Elliptical, 610-720 x 230-320 µm , immersed to surface
Cylindrical, 230-590 x 3.5-4.0 µm with ascus cap 3.6-4.0 µm in diameter
Filamentous, 300-570 x 1.0 µm , not broken into part-spores
Single or cluster, simple or branched, cylindrical, white to white-orange
Elongate-ellipsoid or elongate-ovoid, 290-570 x 120-245 µm , superficial
Filiform, 280-390 x 1 µm , not broken into part-spores
Pyriform, with protruding apices, yellowish, 300 x 150-170 µm , immersed
Bifusiform, 145-220 µm in length, central part filiform about 0.4 µm wide, terminal parts narrowly fusiform, about 30 x 1.6 µm and 3 septate
Cluster, cylindrical, Light yellow to orange red
One to two in a group, clavate, orange
Ellipsoid to ovoid, 288-400 x 103-240 μm , with a wall about 10 μm thick, loosely embedded at right angles to the surface
Cylindrical, 168-205 x (3.7-)4.1-5.5(-6.6) μm , with oblate spheroid or hemispherical refractive cap 3.4-3.8 x 2.9-3.4 μm at apex
Filiform, irregularly multiseptate, part-spores 3.6-7.8 x 1.0-1.4 μm
Cespitose, narrowly clavate, light yellow to reddish-brown
Ovoid, 250-450 x 125-250 μm , brown, with a definite wall 25 μm thick, embedded at right angles to the surface
Cylindrical, 150-260 x 3-4 μm , with a 1.5-2 μm thick cap
Solitary or several, clavate, orange to red
Ovoid to fusiform, 360-400 x 130-200 μm , crowded, red, ordinal in orientation, immersed
Ovoid but apex sharply pointed, 335-490 x 145-240 μm , partially immersed at right angle to the surface
Cylindrical, 180-200 x 2.4-4.0 μm wide, caps hemispherical, 1.8-2.2 x 2.5-3.2 μm
Filiform, 180-220 x 0.45-0.65 μm , not at all bifusiform and not broken into part-spores
Globose to ovoid, 180-600 x 180-520 μm , with a thick wall about 10-15 μm , partially immersed at right angles to the surface
Cylindrical, 80-300 x 2.5-5 μm , caps hemispheric, 3.0-4.0 x 2.0-3.0 μm at apex
Single or multiple, clavate, white to orange
Globose to ovoid, 120-230 x 90-170 μm , with a thick wall about 15 μm , immersed to surface
Cylindrical, 225-625 x 4-5 μm , caps hemispherical, 3.0-4.0 x 2.2-3.2 μm at apex
Single or multiple, clavate, orange to light red
Almond-shaped to ovoid, 220-340 x 110-220 μm , with a thick wall about 15-20 μm , immersed to surface
